model

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Cell

  • public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a cell in the minesweeper board

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cell(int x, int y)
      Constructs a new cell object with default values (unflagged, no mine, uncovered) and sets its location accordingly given the specified parameters

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flag()
      Places a flag on the cell.
      int[] getLoc()
      Returns the location of this cell in grid coordinates as an array.
      int getNumMinesAround()
      Returns the number of mines surrounding this cell.
      boolean hasMine()
      Checks to see whether this cell contains a mine
      boolean isFlagged()
      Checks to see whether a flag has been placed on this cell
      boolean isUncovered()
      Checks to see whether the cell has already been uncovered by the client.
      void placeMine()
      Places a mine in this cell.
      void setNumMinesAround(int n)
      Sets the number of mines surrounding this cell.
      void uncover()
      Will uncover the cell.
      void unflag()
      Removes the flag on the cell.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cell

        public Cell(int x,
    int y)
        Constructs a new cell object with default values (unflagged, no mine, uncovered) and sets its location accordingly given the specified parameters
        Parameters:
        x - the row-coordinate of the cell (between 0 and 15 inclusive)
        y - the column-coordinate of the cell (between 0 and 15 inclusive)

    • Method Detail

      • getNumMinesAround

        public int getNumMinesAround()
        Returns the number of mines surrounding this cell.
        Returns:
        the number of mines in the at most 8 surrounding cells.

      • setNumMinesAround

        public void setNumMinesAround(int n)
        Sets the number of mines surrounding this cell. Only to be called once by the program, and never by the user.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of mines surrounding the cell

      • getLoc

        public int[] getLoc()
        Returns the location of this cell in grid coordinates as an array.
        Returns:
        The location of the cell as a two-element array a such that:
        a[0] is the cell's row on the board, and
        a[1] is the cell's column on the board

      • hasMine

        public boolean hasMine()
        Checks to see whether this cell contains a mine
        Returns:
        true if the cell has a mine.

      • placeMine

        public void placeMine()
        Places a mine in this cell. Not to be called by the client.

      • isFlagged

        public boolean isFlagged()
        Checks to see whether a flag has been placed on this cell
        Returns:
        true if the cell has a flag

      • flag

        public void flag()
        Places a flag on the cell. This method will be called when the client clicks on a cell in the GUI

      • unflag

        public void unflag()
        Removes the flag on the cell. Precondition: the cell is already flagged.

      • isUncovered

        public boolean isUncovered()
        Checks to see whether the cell has already been uncovered by the client.
        Returns:
        true if the cell is uncovered.

      • uncover

        public void uncover()
        Will uncover the cell. To be called by the client when cell is left-clicked
